Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

{"data":{"repository":{"pr73":{"reviewThreads":{"nodes":[{"id":"PRRT_kwDORICdSM5vGIpQ","isResolved":true,"path":"src/api/routes/auth.js","line":143,"comments":{"nodes":[{"author":{"login":"cursor"},"body":"### OAuth2 flow lacks CSRF state parameter protection **High Severity** The OAuth2 authorization flow doesn't include a `state` parameter in the redirect to Discord, and the callback handler doesn't validate one. Per RFC 9700, clients MUST implement CSRF protection via a state parameter. Without it, an attacker can perform a login CSRF attack ‚Äî tricking a victim into completing an OAuth flow with the attacker's authorization code, causing the victim's browser to receive a JWT for the attacker's Discord account.
Additional Locations (1) - [`src/api/routes/auth.js#L38-L44`](https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/blob/86ad3a43ed29d8e76d603dbf9c23056b25e81832/src/api/routes/auth.js#L38-L44)

 

"}]}},{"id":"PRRT_kwDORICdSM5vGIpU","isResolved":true,"path":"src/utils/permissions.js","line":null,"comments":{"nodes":[{"author":{"login":"cursor"},"body":"### Config `botOwners` field is never used by code **Medium Severity** `BOT_OWNER_ID` is hardcoded as a constant in `permissions.js`, while `config.json` adds a `botOwners` array that is never read by any code. This makes the config field misleading ‚Äî adding or removing IDs in `botOwners` has zero effect. The `isBotOwner` function only checks the hardcoded constant, so changing bot owners requires a code change rather than a config change.
Additional Locations (1) - [`config.json#L84-L85`](https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/blob/86ad3a43ed29d8e76d603dbf9c23056b25e81832/config.json#L84-L85)

 

"}]}},{"id":"PRRT_kwDORICdSM5vGIpZ","isResolved":true,"path":"src/api/routes/auth.js","line":null,"comments":{"nodes":[{"author":{"login":"cursor"},"body":"### JWT token exposed in redirect URL query parameter **Medium Severity** The OAuth2 callback redirects with the full JWT appended as a URL query parameter (`?token=...`). OWASP explicitly calls out this risk pattern and notes how Node‚Äôs `jsonwebtoken` API shape can make this mistake easy if you don‚Äôt pin algorithms. [1] Separately, `jsonwebtoken` (npm) **did have** a real verification bypass: **versions ‚â§ 8.5.1** could accept **unsigned** tokens in a specific scenario (no `algorithms` specified + a **falsy** key/secret), due to defaulting to `none`; this was **patched in 9.0.0** (removing default support for `none`). [2] Also, people often mix up `jsonwebtoken` with the similarly named package `json-web-token` (npm), which has a published advisory for an **algorithm-confusion vulnerability** (CVE-2023-48238 / GHSA-4xw9-cx39-r355).
